newsitem.title: ESTONIA: HANSAPANK DOMINATES SOLID SHARE TRADE.
newsitem.headline: HANSAPANK DOMINATES SOLID SHARE TRADE.

text.p: * Total trade on the Estonian bourse was 75.2 million kroons
versus Monday's 61.6 million kroons.
* The Talse gained 1.56 percent to close on 271.77
* Hansapank's share price was 6.65 kroons stronger
to close on 286.15 kroons on trade of 36.9 million kroons.
* Dealers said that short-term, small investors dominated
trade. Hansapank was helped by follow on from its first quarter
results and by investors positioning themselves on the last day
of cum-dividend trading in the stock.
Hansapank again led a rally on
a busy day's trade on the stock exchange on Tuesday as investors
rushed to buy Hanspank stock on the last day of cum-dividend
trading and in the wake of its good first quarter results.
The Talse rose by 1.56 percent to close on 271.77 kroons
with 67.7 million kroons of shares traded on the main list.
Total market capitalisation was higher at 14.56 billion
kroons compared to Monday's 14.30 billion kroons.
"The day was very busy as people were to trying to get even
the smallest advantage out of the market," one trader said.
"It was not the behaviour of long-term investors," he added.
"Wednesday is expected to see more sellers and volumes lower."
Hansapank turned over 36.9 million kroons to dominate trade.
The stock gained 6.65 kroons to close on 286.15 kroons.
Today was the last day of cum-dividend trading and also the
last day for inclusion on the list of share holders for the
bank's bonus share issue.
"The interest in Hansapank was due to the last day for the
cum-dividend trading and people hoping to make a quick profit on
the bonus share issue," another trader said.
The bank also benefited from follow-on interest after it
yesterday reported a sharp rise in first quarter profit.
Hoiupank saw trade of 12.5 million kroons of
shares to be stable on 133.00 kroons.
"There was some large sellers on the market, but all the
shares were taken up," he added.
On the over-the-counter market, total trade was 7.4 million
kroons of shares with diversified industrialist Norma the most
active stock.
Norma traded 2.8 millions kroons of shares to close 2.75
kroons higher on 78.50 kroons.
"The strong interest stayed with Norma after the release of
the final first quarter profit figures, but the volumes on the
free market were quite low," a dealer said.
Norma's adjusted first quarter net profit results were 24.2
million kroons, slightly higher than previously announced.
-- David Mardiste, Tallinn newsroom +372 630 8400
reuters@reuters.ee
